verses.text: 羅波安離棄耶和華羅波安的王位穩定，他也強盛起來，就離棄了耶和華的律法，全體以色列人也都跟隨他。

words.note: Abbreviation for 列王紀上 (Lièwáng Jì Shàng)
起來 as a directional complement indicating initiation/completion of an action
Often refers to God's law in biblical context.

verses.text: 羅波安王第五年，埃及王示撒上來攻打耶路撒冷，因為他們得罪了耶和華。

words.note: Biblically, it often means to sin against God.

verses.text: 示撒率領戰車一千二百輛，馬兵六萬，和他一同從埃及出來的路比人、蘇基人和古實人，多得無法數算。

words.note: Refers to ancient war chariots.

verses.text: 他攻取了猶大境內的設防城，然後來到耶路撒冷。
那時，猶大的眾領袖，因為示撒的緣故，就聚集在耶路撒冷；示瑪雅先知就來見羅波安和眾領袖，對他們說：「耶和華這樣說：『你們既然離棄了我，所以我也離棄你們，把你們交在示撒的手裡。』」

words.note: Used before nouns to mean 'all' or 'many'.
Often used in the structure '因為...的緣故' meaning 'because of...'
Lit. 'one who knows beforehand'.
交 (deliver) + 在 (at/in) indicating the resulting location/possession.

verses.text: 於是以色列的眾領袖和君王，都謙卑下來，說：「耶和華是公義的。」

words.note: Lit. 'leading sleeve', a metaphor for prominence.
謙卑 (humble) + 下來 (down, indicates completed action or state).

verses.text: 耶和華看見他們謙卑下來，耶和華的話就臨到示瑪雅，說：「他們既然謙卑下來，我就不滅絕他們；我必使他們暫時得救，我必不藉著示撒把我的烈怒傾倒在耶路撒冷。

words.note: 謙卑 (humble) + 下來 (down, indicates completed action or state).
謙卑 (humble) + 下來 (down, indicates completed action or state).

verses.text: 雖然這樣，他們仍必作示撒的僕人，好使他們知道，服事我和服事世上的列國有甚麼分別。」
掠奪聖殿與王宮的寶物於是埃及王示撒上來攻打耶路撒冷，奪取了耶和華殿和王宮裡的寶物，把它們全部帶走，又奪去了所羅門所做的金盾牌。

words.note: Short for 列王紀上 (First Book of Kings).

words.definition: to take away by force, seize

verses.text: 羅波安王做了一些銅盾牌代替那些金盾牌，交給那些看守宮門的守衛長看管。
每逢王進耶和華殿的時候，守衛就來拿這些盾牌，事後又把盾牌送回守衛房那裡。

words.note: The Hebrew name for God.
Indicates the object of the verb precedes the verb.

verses.text: 王既然謙卑下來，耶和華的烈怒就止息，沒有把他完全消滅。何況在猶大中還有善事。

words.note: Indicates a downward direction or a state of settling.
The Hebrew name for God.
Often used in biblical contexts to describe God's wrath.
More formal or literary than '停止'.
Indicates the object of the verb precedes the verb.
Can refer to the tribe, kingdom, or region of Judah.

verses.text: 羅波安王在耶路撒冷漸漸強盛，繼續作王。羅波安登基的時候是四十一歲；他在耶和華從以色列眾支派中選出來，立下他名的耶路撒冷城中，作王十七年。羅波安的母親名叫拿瑪，是亞捫人。

words.note: Formal term for a monarch's ascension.
The Hebrew name for God.
Can refer to the people, nation, or land of Israel.
Specific to biblical context of Israelite tribes.

verses.text: 羅波安行惡，因為他沒有定意尋求耶和華。

words.note: Commonly used in religious or moral contexts.
The Hebrew name for God.

verses.text: 羅波安逝世羅波安的事蹟，一生的始末，不是都記在示瑪雅先知和先見易多有關家譜的記錄上麼？羅波安和耶羅波安二人常有爭戰。

words.note: A formal or polite term for death.
Abbreviation for 列王紀上 (Book of 1 Kings).
Often refers to historical records of achievements.
Literary term, often used for historical accounts.
Used here to form a rhetorical question.
Biblical term for a prophet who sees visions.
Used as a locative suffix here, meaning 'on/in the records'.
Turns a statement into a rhetorical question or assumption.

verses.text: 羅波安和他的列祖同睡，埋葬在大衛城裡。他的兒子亞比雅接續他作王。

words.note: A biblical euphemism for death, especially of kings.
Often used in Bible cross-references.
Abbreviation for 列王紀上 (Lièwángjì Shàng).
